page.title: 05Cornish Customs
page.content: Hurling the Silver Ball is an ancient Cornish game which is still played in Saint Columb.In this game two teams made up of people from the village and its surrounding area,called Town or Country try to score a goal with a ball made of apple wood and covered in silver.The goals are about three miles apart and the game can last all day.It starys in the village and the teams frequently stop to allow spectators to touch the ball for luck.The game is very rough and amongst the 100 or 200 players there are quite often broken arms and legs but scoring a goal entitles you to keep the ball provided that you pay for another to be made.A new ball costs several hundred pounds and around it on the silver is engraved Town and Country do your best.
